summary: 'Avengers: Endgame' set footage shows Robert Downey Jr filming the snap
title: 'Avengers: Endgame' set footage shows Robert Downey Jr filming the snap
body:
WARNING: There are MAJOR SPOILERS ahead for Avengers: Endgame. So if you’re yet to see the mega blockbuster then please don’t read ahead.

The ultimate piece of behind the scenes footage from Avengers: Endgame has dropped online, which shows Robert Downey Jr filming the already iconic snap from its climax.

Kudos to Jimmy Rich, who just so happens to be Robert Downey Jr’s assistant, for uploading the video of the Oscar nominated actor going all in on his line reading of, “I am Iron Man.”

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by jimmy rich (@jimmy_rich) on Jun 20, 2019 at 10:39pm PDT

Of course, this was in response to Thanos declaring, “I am inevitable,” after he had finally got hold of the Infinity Gauntlet, only for him to discover that Tony Stark had taken all of the Infinity Stones out and put them into his newly made Iron Man Gauntlet.

Read More: It was Robert Downey Jr’s decision to stay silent in Endgame finale

By doing this, though, Stark succumbed to the power of the snap, but did save the galaxy in the process.

Rather surprisingly, this moment was actually the last thing that the Russo Brothers shot during the Endgame reshoots back in January. As the above footage shows, it was completed in a rather intimate setting in Hollywood’s Raleigh Studios rather than Atlanta, where most of the MCU has been filmed.

Read more: Avengers spoiler-ban lifts

“Tony used to not say anything in that moment,” the directors admitted during a post Q&A screening back in DC back in May. “And we were in the editing room going, ‘He has to say something. This a character who has lived and died by quips.’ And we just couldn’t, we tried a million different last lines.”

“Thanos was saying ‘I am inevitable.’ And our editor Jeff Ford, who’s been with us all four movies and is an amazing storyteller, said, ‘Why don’t we just go full circle with it and say, I am Iron Man.’ And we’re like, ‘Get the cameras! We have to shoot this tomorrow.’”

Robert Downey Jr as Iron Man in Avengers: Endgame

WARNING: There are MAJOR SPOILERS ahead for Avengers: Endgame. So if you’re yet to see the mega blockbuster then please don’t read ahead.

The ultimate piece of behind the scenes footage from Avengers: Endgame has dropped online, which shows Robert Downey Jr filming the already iconic snap from its climax.

Kudos to Jimmy Rich, who just so happens to be Robert Downey Jr’s assistant, for uploading the video of the Oscar nominated actor going all in on his line reading of, “I am Iron Man.”

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by jimmy rich (@jimmy_rich) on Jun 20, 2019 at 10:39pm PDT

Of course, this was in response to Thanos declaring, “I am inevitable,” after he had finally got hold of the Infinity Gauntlet, only for him to discover that Tony Stark had taken all of the Infinity Stones out and put them into his newly made Iron Man Gauntlet.

Read More: It was Robert Downey Jr’s decision to stay silent in Endgame finale

By doing this, though, Stark succumbed to the power of the snap, but did save the galaxy in the process.

Kevin Feige, Chris Hemsworth, Chris Evans, Scarlett Johansson, Mark Ruffalo and Jeremy Renner Place Their Hand Prints In Cement At TCL Chinese Theatre IMAX Forecourt held at TCL Chinese Theatre IMAX. (Photo by Albert L. Ortega/Getty Images)

Rather surprisingly, this moment was actually the last thing that the Russo Brothers shot during the Endgame reshoots back in January. As the above footage shows, it was completed in a rather intimate setting in Hollywood’s Raleigh Studios rather than Atlanta, where most of the MCU has been filmed.

Read more: Avengers spoiler-ban lifts

“Tony used to not say anything in that moment,” the directors admitted during a post Q&A screening back in DC back in May. “And we were in the editing room going, ‘He has to say something. This a character who has lived and died by quips.’ And we just couldn’t, we tried a million different last lines.”

“Thanos was saying ‘I am inevitable.’ And our editor Jeff Ford, who’s been with us all four movies and is an amazing storyteller, said, ‘Why don’t we just go full circle with it and say, I am Iron Man.’ And we’re like, ‘Get the cameras! We have to shoot this tomorrow.’”

title: (Marvel/Avengers Fic) Peace in My Grave.
description:
Natasha chuckled softly; whatever expression had had upon his face in his disbelief evidently causing the woman across the bar much amusement – be it ever so slightly at his expense. “What’s wrong, Bruce? You look like you’ve seen a ghost,” she teased, cocking her head to one side and raising her eyebrows. Bruce supposed he had.

body:
Avengers: Endgame, Robert Downey jr in un BTS dalla scena dello schiocco finale

Avengers: Endgame potrà essere uscito nelle sale due mesi fa, ma questo non ha impedito alle persone coinvolte nel film del Marvel Cinematic Universe di continuare a condividere contenuti dietro le quinte.

L’ultimo video BTS proviene da Jimmy Rich, che ha lavorato come assistente di Robert Downey Jr durante la maggior parte dei suoi film dal 2003.

Oh my god he's already forty. I can't believe it.
I want to wish a happy birthday to a very...
body:
🎉HappyBirthday Chris Pratt!🎉

Oh my god he’s already forty. I can’t believe it.

I want to wish a happy birthday to a very talented actor named Chris Pratt. I want to thank him for many funny scenes ( Like in Guardians of the Galaxy) and kinda sad scenes (Infinity War).

I hope he keeps up with the good work

summary: 'Avengers: Endgame' Leads The Nominations For The 2019 Teen Choice Awards With Nine Nods
title: 'Avengers: Endgame' Leads The Nominations For The 2019 Teen Choice Awards With Nine Nods
excerpt: Avengers: Endgame is the biggest movie of 2019, with only 45 million required to surpass the all-time total of Avatar, it will soon be the biggest movie of all time. It is only fair that the biggest movie gets the highest number of nominations at the Teen Choice Awards. 'Avengers: Endgame' Leads The Nominations For The 2019 Teen Choice Awards With Nine Nods.

summary: Marvel News: Marvel Loves Keanu And The End Of June Re-Release For Avengers: Endgame
title: Marvel News: Marvel Loves Keanu And The End Of June Re-Release For Avengers: Endgame
body:
Marvel News: Marvel Loves Keanu And The End Of June Re-Release For Avengers: Endgame

Credit: Roy Rochlin/Getty Images

The first half of 2019 has seen Keanu Reeves very busy.

In March, there was a first look at Duke Caboom – an Evel Knievel-like stunt motorcyclist character which Reeves is voicing for the upcoming Toy Story 4.

Then came news about Bill and Ted Face The Music, currently in production, then the first trailers for John Wick Chapter 3 – Parabellum made an appearance.

View On WordPress

summary:
#AvengersEndgame regresa a los cines con una escena post-credito ¿Regresa Iron Man?

Avengers: Endgame está oficialmente...
caption:
#AvengersEndgame regresa a los cines con una escena post-credito ¿Regresa Iron Man?

Avengers: Endgame está oficialmente regresando a los cines la próxima semana con varias escenas que incluyen algunas escenas eliminadas y una larga escena posterior al crédito que sorprenderá a varios fanáticos de Marvel.
